title: LMS Sales Executive
description:
**Title: Digital Sales Executive - Local Marketing Solutions**

**Location: New York**

**Department: Commercial**

**Salary: Up to $70K + uncapped commission**

  

**Role overview**  

As a sales account executive in our Local Marketing Solutions team, your role will be to account manage and grow a portfolio of clients across LA, Boston, NYC and beyond, providing local businesses with access to Time Out’s suite of promotional products. The role will combine account management and driving new business across all the verticals Time Out covers editorially. Our Local Marketing Solutions department is fast-paced and dynamic, and we are looking for ambitious salespeople with a drive to succeed. The ideal candidate will have a passion for Time Out, a good knowledge of the city, a dedication to delivering world-class service to clients, and an exceptionally high attention to detail.


**Key Responsibilities**

* Account manage a portfolio of existing clients, making sure they are highly satisfied in their partnership with Time Out, while also driving additional revenue throughout the lifetime of their contract.
* Manage your own leads and utilise online and offline sources to cultivate new targets and clients.
* Continuously develop and maintain your pipeline of potential business.
* Make a high volume of daily outbound sales calls to business owners across relevant verticals.
* Drive the full sales cycle to attain new business.
* Achieve and consistently exceed monthly sales goals.
* Work alongside finance, ad ops, project management and editorial teams to ensure revenue is recognised and campaigns delivered.
* Regular feedback to clients on campaign performance and further optimisation opportunities.

 **Skills & Experience**

  

* Previous digital sales experience required, though we are happy to hear from candidates who meet the other requirements, and who feel they can swiftly get to grips with digital sales.
  
* Willingness to learn and develop professionally accompanied by the ability to translate feedback into concrete actions.
* A good understanding of Time Out and the verticals we cover.
* An excellent knowledge of London, especially restaurants, bars and events
* Passionately curious about people, places and local businesses.
* An exceptional level of attention to detail.
* Assertiveness coupled with the ability to listen and persuade others.
* Adaptability coupled with resilience and tenacity.

**What we look for in a candidate**


Time Out is a company filled with individuals as diverse as the cities we are in and cover. At the same time there are common characteristics and values we all share. To join our team, you’ll want to…  

  



* Be commercially astute
* Either have experience at or want to dive headfirst into a fast-paced transformative company in pursuit of excellence
* Think globally
* Have excellent communication and relationship building skills
* Have a high sense of ownership, urgency and drive
* Be a team player

 **About our culture**


At Time Out Group we believe in diversity and equal opportunity for all people. We do not discriminate against external or internal candidates on the basis of age; disability; gender, gender reassignment; race; religion or belief; sexual orientation; marriage and civil partnership; pregnancy and maternity. We believe that diversity develops creativity and enables personal and professional growth where we all learn from each other. We believe in an open culture where ideas are shared candidly and where there is no fear of failure, but rather an understanding that we must experiment and have the freedom to succeed. We believe that everyone has the right to express themselves as they are as this enriches us all. We believe in an open world, social justice, and the pursuit of happiness, after all, we are in the happiness business.  

  

**About Time Out Group plc**

  

Through Time Out Media and Time Out Market we help our large audience go out in the world's greatest cities and connect global brands as well as local talents with this valuable audience.

**Time Out Media**’s multiple digital and physical channels span websites, mobile, social media, video, audio and Live Events. Across these channels, Time Out distributes its high-quality content – curated and created by a global team of local expert journalists – around the best food, drinks, culture, art, music, theatre, travel and entertainment in 333 cities and 59 countries. The Company is giving international, national and local brands and businesses the opportunity to connect with this global reach and strong traffic from a desirable audience by offering bespoke 360-degree multichannel advertising solutions. Since its launch in 1968, Time Out has become a global brand that advertisers and consumers love and trust.

**Time Out Market** is the world's first editorially curated food and cultural market, leveraging the Time Out brand to bring the best of the city together under one roof: its best chefs, drinks and cultural experiences – based on the editorial curation Time Out has always been known for. The first Time Out Market opened in 2014 in Lisbon, quickly turning into one of the most popular destinations in the city. The success of Lisbon brought further expansion and the portfolio currently includes eight Markets:  

in addition to Lisbon, there are sites in New York, Boston, Montreal, Chicago, Dubai, Cape Town and Porto. More Time Out Market locations are in the pipeline as the global expansion continues.

  

Time Out is headquartered in London (United Kingdom) and listed on London's AIM stock exchange, trading under the ticker symbol 'TMO'.

  

Time Out is a dynamic, pioneering brand and so is our team. We want to work with the best and brightest talent because we work for the world’s greatest cities, the people enjoying them and the businesses in them. As a truly global team we get to collaborate with colleagues from New York to Paris, Cape Town and Sydney and beyond. It’s our expertise, authenticity and collaboration that make us successful and a unique team.

title: Pro Video Product Specialist
description:
MPB is the world’s largest online platform for used photography and videography equipment. Our platform transforms the way that people buy, sell and trade in photo and video kit.


We have offices in Brighton, Brooklyn and Berlin and we are rapidly growing in all markets.


As we continue to grow, we’re expanding our team and we are on the lookout for a Pro Video Product Specialist who can join our Product Specialists team in Brooklyn. This team is at the beating heart of what MPB does and checks over all the videography equipment that MPB buys and sells. There’s lots of responsibility but you’ll get the chance to work with all kinds of different video gear.

**What you'll be doing**

* Test items of stock such as Cine Cameras, lenses, drones and gimbals.
* Prepare, photograph and write descriptions of items for sale.
* Ensure items are ready to be published to our marketplace

**What you'll need**

* Knowledge of a range of camera equipment
* A desire to learn and enthusiasm for what MPB does.

**Salary**


$50,000 a year

**Benefits**

* 15 days paid time off
* Creative, modern and open office space
* 401k pension plan, provided by Empower in partnership with Trinet
* Medical Insurance
* Employee Assistance Programme (EAP)
* Enhanced Paid Parental Leave
* MPB Learning Lab
* Employee Discounts & Uplifts
* Paid Volunteering Days
* Milestone Gifts
* Dog-Friendly Workspaces
* Voluntary Insurance Options

title: Retail Sales – Part Time
description:
We are happy you have taken time out of your day to check out this Retail Sales Associate opportunity with Lowe's. Do any of the following statements match your current goals?* I'm at least 18 years old, and I want to share my whole self in an inclusive work environment
* I want to work for a company who welcomes and appreciates the military community
* I'm retired, but I still want to work part-time or full-time
* I currently have a job and need supplementary income
* I want to build a career with a company that doesn’t require a four-year degree
* I'm a stay-at-home parent, ready to return to work
* I need flexibility in my schedule because I have children or other responsibilities
* I'm interested in debt-free education, tuition reimbursement, or certificate programs
* I want to learn a skilled trade and possibly start my own company
* I am bilingual
* I love DIY projects

  

Whatever your need for employment, we at Lowe's believe we can help you build a better life and career, and we are all-in to help you achieve your goals. We are hiring immediately for this role, so make sure you apply today.  

  

**Here's what you will do in this role:**  

As a Lowe's **Retail Sales Associate – Part-Time**, you are the key to our customers' positive shopping experiences. You will be the smiling person who greets customers as they enter our doors or shop our aisles. You will engage customers regarding the types of projects they are working on and how you may help. You will guide shoppers to the right products or introduce them to the appropriate sales specialist who can assist. As you learn more about your department and Lowe's, you will understand which products naturally go together. It will be your responsibility to ensure that you share this knowledge with your customers. Here's an example: If a customer is looking for a lamp, do they need a shade? What about light bulbs? See, it's that simple!  

  

Lowe's offers jobs for people who aren't interested in sitting behind a desk for hours. Instead of answering phones, you might be in the store or the garden center, walking, talking to our customers, watering plants, and restocking items. Depending on your department, some lifting (building materials, paint, or maybe mulch) may be required with or without assistance.  

  

**What's in It for You?**  

Beyond the chance to make a difference for customers and teammates, each day will allow you to learn, grow, and celebrate wins together with your Lowe's team. Our associates enjoy the following benefits:  

* A 10% discount on everything at Lowe's
* Eligible for debt-free education and skilled trade programs
* Access to comprehensive physical, mental, and financial benefits\\*
* Opportunity to earn quarterly bonuses
* Flexible schedules to fit your lifestyle
* Career growth—over 50% of our leaders started as hourly associates

  

**Your Day at Lowe's**  

* Deliver excellent customer service
* Help customers find products and provide recommendations
* Help load customer merchandise
* Restock merchandise

  

**Requirements**  

* Be able to lift up to 25lbs. unassisted, or over 25lbs assisted.
* Possess 6 months experience operating common retail technology, smartphones, tablets, or computers.
* For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, email HRServiceCenter@lowes.com.

  

***Bilingual applicants are encouraged to apply.***  

  

* Benefits offerings change each year and eligibility varies. For the most up-to-date breakdown of what's available to you, visit MyLowesBenefits.com.

  

***Bilingual, Military, and Veteran applicants are encouraged to apply.***
Pay Range: $17.00 - $17.70 per hour*Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit our* *benefits page**.*

*Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.*


Pay Range: $17.00 - $17.70 per hour Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.
company_description: Lowe's is an American chain of retail home improvement and appliance stores that has retail stores in the United States.

title: Full Time - Fulfillment Team Lead - Day
description:
**What You Will Do**  

All Lowe’s associates deliver quality customer service while maintaining a store that is clean, safe, and stocked with the products our customers need. As a Fulfillment Lead, this means:  

* Picking and checking merchandise for customer pickup, delivery, and installer pickup.
* Being friendly and professional, and engaging customers as they enter the store, helping them find merchandise if needed.
* Engaging in safe work practices and encouraging others to do the same.


The Fulfillment Lead spends most of his/her time checking, managing, and fulfilling orders. These orders consist of online, pick up later, delivery, install and pro. As Fulfillment Lead, he/she provides supervision, coaching, and support to the Fulfillment Associates. This associate also assists by making recommendations to solve issues and by prioritizing work to meet customer needs.  

Travel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores.  

  

**What We're Looking For**  

* Hourly Full Time or Part Time: Generally scheduled 39 to 40 or up to 25 hours per week, respectively; more hours may be required based on the needs of the store.
* Requires morning, afternoon and evening availability any day of the week.
* Physical ability to perform tasks that may require prolonged standing, sitting, and other activities necessary to perform job duties.
* Minimally must be able to lift 25 pounds without assistance; may lift over 25 pounds with or without assistance.

  

**What You Need To Succeed**  

Minimum Qualifications  

* Ability to read, write, and perform basic arithmetic (addition, subtraction).
* 6 months of experience using a computer, including inputting, accessing, modifying, or outputting information.
* 6 months experience using common retail technology, such as smart phones and tablets.
* 1 year of retail experience providing customer service, including identifying and resolving customer issues, greeting customers, answering phones, building relationships with customers, and thanking customers for their business.
* Ability to obtain sales related licensure or registration as may be required by law.

  

*Preferred Qualifications*  

* 6 months experience working in any department at a Lowe’s retail store.
* 6 months of experience in an administrative role processing and filing paperwork including invoices.
* 1 year of supervisory experience in any field, including directing, delegating, evaluating, training, and coaching employees.
* 1 year of experience in a customer service or product fulfillment position at a home improvement or hardware retailer in related department (e.g., kitchen, plumbing, electrical, lawn and garden).
*Lowe’s is an equal opportunity employer and administers all personnel practices without regard to race, color, religious creed, sex, gender, age, ancestry, national origin, mental or physical disability or medical condition, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, military or veteran status, genetic information, or any other category protected under federal, state, or local law.*


Starting rate of pay may vary based on factors including, but not limited to, position offered, location, education, training, and/or experience. For information regarding our benefit programs and eligibility, please visit https://talent.lowes.com/us/en/benefits.

title: Digital Assets Coordinator - Hoboken, NJ
description:
**Job ID:** 900

**Alternate Locations:**

  

Newell Brands is a leading $8.3B consumer products company with a portfolio of iconic brands such as Graco®, Coleman®, Oster®, Rubbermaid® and Sharpie®, and 25,000 talented employees around the world. Our high-performance culture, unparalleled curiosity about the world around us, and talented people fuel our success. Our culture is enabled through our core values which guide all we do and how we win as One Newell. They are Integrity, Teamwork, Passion for Winning, Ownership & Leadership.

 **Position Overview:**


The Digital Asset Coordinator will play a critical role in driving consistency with asset tagging and uploading that will drive efficiency in our current processes. This role will be responsible for coordinating, storing, cataloging, and distributing digital assets within Newell Brands. The position requires strong organizational skills, attention to detail, and the ability to collaborate with several cross-functional team members.

 **Location:** This is a hybrid role and must be based in our office located in Hoboken, NJ.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Execute uploading and tagging of all creative assets that follows standard tagging protocol that includes following digital content playbooks.
* Ensure metadata tagging of all creative assets uploaded adhere to data architecture standards and best practices.
* Identify and tag User-Generated Content (UGC) from social media platforms or other sources as directed by Performance Marketing and Creative leaders
* Properly tag and categorize UGC content in the DAM system as it relates to product identification and rights usage, for future use in marketing materials and campaigns.
* Conduct regular audits of the digital asset library to ensure accuracy, consistency, and compliance with digital content playbooks, alt text, VTT, and tagging standards.
* Work with outside agency partners, internal teams, and new AI tools to develop automations. Initiatives to include improved DAM keyword accuracy, tagging, rights management, alt text/VTT, and report on content readiness.
* Implement digital asset management strategies, policies, and procedures to ensure efficient organization and retrieval of digital assets.
* Partner with IT and the DAM software client services team to help maximize our investment in the software.
* Work directly with Design, Digital Merchandising, DTC, IT and Brand team to resolve data management needs.
* Work closely with Data Governance team to implement the process of digital asset management uploading and tagging to meet strict quality standards.
* Document best practices, research options for continuous improvement, and provide recommendations for technical innovation pathways.
* Proactively advise cross-functional partners of upcoming usage expirations.
* Contribute to discussions of metadata standards and data harmonization across projects.
* Provide input for cross functional team needs for new data management infrastructure.
* Participate in internal cross-functional data infrastructure projects.

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Library Science, Information Science, Digital Media or equivalent professional experience.
* Minimum of 2 years of experience in the field of asset management, enterprise content management, or supporting DAM systems for a large client or company.
* Strong understanding of digital asset management principles, standards, and best practices.
* Experience working with DAM systems (e.g., Media Beacon, Adobe Experience Manager, Bynder, Widen, etc.).
* Familiarity with graphic design, photography, video production, and other creative processes is a plus.
* Knowledge of copyright laws and usage rights for digital assets.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and adapt to changing priorities and deadlines
* Experience working within cross-functional marketing and creative teams.
* Detail-oriented and able to execute with considerations of the macro and micro level of impact of asset management

  

Newell Brands (NASDAQ: NWL) is a leading global consumer goods company with a strong portfolio of well-known brands, including Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Graco, Coleman, Rubbermaid Commercial Products, Yankee Candle, Paper Mate, FoodSaver, Dymo, EXPO, Elmer’s, Oster, NUK, Spontex and Campingaz. We are focused on delighting consumers by lighting up everyday moments. Newell Brands and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and comply with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

title: Proofreader
description:
**Job ID:** 878

**Alternate Locations:** United States-New Jersey-Hoboken; United States-Georgia-Atlanta; United States-Michigan-Kalamazoo

  

Newell Brands is a leading $8.3B consumer products company with a portfolio of iconic brands such as Graco®, Coleman®, Oster®, Rubbermaid® and Sharpie®, and 25,000 talented employees around the world. Our high-performance culture, unparalleled curiosity about the world around us, and talented people fuel our success. Our culture is enabled through our core values which guide all we do and how we win as One Newell. They are Integrity, Teamwork, Passion for Winning, Ownership & Leadership.

  

Location: This is a hybrid role and must be based in one of our offices located in either Hoboken, NJ, Atlanta, GA or Kalamazoo, MI.

  

Newell Brands is searching for dynamic, detail-oriented Proofreader to join our content team and support a diverse portfolio of iconic consumer goods brands including Marmot, Coleman, Graco, Baby Jogger, Crock-Pot, Calphalon, Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Elmer’s,Yankee Candle, and more.


As a Proofreader with 2-3 years of experience, you'll play a pivotal role in maintaining the quality and integrity of our written content. You'll have the chance to work with a dynamic team, reviewing a variety of materials such as documents, articles, and marketing collateral. Your keen attention to detail will be instrumental in catching errors and inconsistencies, ensuring that our content is polished and professional.


The right candidate for this role is comfortable working independently, can set their own priorities and multitask well, but is also a true collaborator and always open to learn. You must be adaptable and able to switch between editing styles as you navigate content across brands. You value consistency and accuracy, and enjoy a fast-paced and flexible work environment. Experience in ecommerce is preferred.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Proofreading omni-channel content: packaging materials, in-store signage, product copy, digital marketing assets
* Reviewing Text: Carefully read through content to detect and correct errors in grammar, spelling, punctuation, syntax, and formatting.
* Ensuring Accuracy: Verify factual accuracy, consistency, and adherence to specified style guides or brand guidelines.
* Correcting Errors: Fix typos, grammatical mistakes, and inconsistencies in style, tone, or voice.
* Checking Formatting: Ensure that text layout, font usage, headings, and other formatting elements conform to established standards.
* Maintaining Consistency: Ensure consistency in language usage, terminology, abbreviations, and formatting throughout the document or publication.
* Fact-Checking: Verify dates, names, places, and other factual information for accuracy.
* Providing Feedback: Offer constructive feedback to writers or content creators regarding areas for improvement in clarity, coherence, and overall quality.
* Collaborating with Writers, Designers and Operations: Work closely writers, designers and other stakeholders to address any concerns or questions related to the text.
* Meeting Deadlines: Complete proofreading tasks within specified timeframes to meet project deadlines.
* Adapting to Different Styles: Be flexible in adapting to various writing styles, tones, and target audiences depending on the nature of the content being proofread.
* Using Proofreading Tools: Stay abreast of innovations and best practices to assist in the proofreading process.
* Understanding Publishing Requirements: Familiarize oneself with publishing requirements, including copyright laws, citation styles, and industry standards.
* Staying Updated: Stay informed about language usage trends, grammar rules, and changes in style guides to maintain professional proficiency.
* Performs other tasks as needed

 **Key Qualifications:**

* The successful candidate will be a proven team contributor with experience in retail, e-commerce, or CPG direct-to-consumer.
* 3+ years of experience in proofreading/copyediting
* Knowledge of AP Stylebook & Chicago Manual of Style
* Demonstrated integrity and maturity, and a constructive approach to challenges
* Ability to operate independently given direction, and bring ideas and solutions to issues raised
* Strong passion for both speed and simplicity
* Strong written and verbal communication skills
* Interpersonal savvy; an ability to effectively work with and connect with all levels of employees across multiple functions and geographies
* Detail-oriented and operationally-focused; strong organizing skills
* Capacity for critical thinking and problem-solving, especially when addressing complex language issues or ambiguous text.
* Demonstrated ability to lead multiple activities and assignments simultaneously
* BS/BA or University degree in English preferred but not required


Newell Brands (NASDAQ: NWL) is a leading global consumer goods company with a strong portfolio of well-known brands, including Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Graco, Coleman, Rubbermaid Commercial Products, Yankee Candle, Paper Mate, FoodSaver, Dymo, EXPO, Elmer’s, Oster, NUK, Spontex and Campingaz. We are focused on delighting consumers by lighting up everyday moments. Newell Brands and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and comply with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

title: Associate Manager Corporate Strategy
description:
**Job ID:** 934

**Alternate Locations:** Atlanta, GA

  

Newell Brands is a leading $8.3B consumer products company with a portfolio of iconic brands such as Graco®, Coleman®, Oster®, Rubbermaid® and Sharpie®, and 25,000 talented employees around the world. Our high-performance culture, unparalleled curiosity about the world around us, and talented people fuel our success. Our culture is enabled through our core values which guide all we do and how we win as One Newell. They are Integrity, Teamwork, Passion for Winning, Ownership & Leadership.

 **Position Summary:**


The Associate Strategy Manager will play a key role in shaping the strategic direction of Newell Brands. This role involves working on the development and ongoing management of strategies that deliver value and support growth ambitions. Reporting to the Sr Manager of Strategy, you will assist in strategic thought partnership across functions including, but not limited to, Sales, Marketing, Finance, R&D, Design, and Legal. Given the high visibility of this role, the candidate must be comfortable interacting with all levels of the organization, including senior leadership.


A successful candidate will possess deep analytical skills, strategic thinking, and the ability to work on complex projects in a fast-paced environment. You will be responsible for developing executive-level presentations that synthesize complex information and data to develop strategic insights and recommendations, and for managing the corresponding project work.


Unsure if you meet all the qualifications but are excited about the opportunity? We still encourage you to apply! We believe skills and experience can be transferrable, and that enthusiastic, proactive learners make for great candidates.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* **Problem-Solving:** Develop hypothesis-driven work plans to address complex strategic questions. Support problem-solving through strategic framing, root cause identification, and conducting ad-hoc analyses to test hypotheses. Identify risks, highlight mitigation tactics, and proactively manage challenges to ensure impactful outcomes.
* **Data and qualitative analysis:** Perform advanced analysis of quantitative and qualitative data to uncover key insights and trends.
* **Storytelling and visual communication:** Distill complex information and data into clear and compelling narratives and communicate insights and recommendations verbally and through visually appealing presentations.
* **Agile self-starter mentality**: Ability to work with speed and agility to meet tight deadlines, work independently with minimal direction, and demonstrate resilience and agility in ambiguous situations to deliver impactful results.
* **Research:** Perform in-depth research using a variety of internal and external sources to ensure that decision-makers have sufficient data to effectively answer questions. This includes but is not limited to analyzing market trends, consumer behaviors, industry dynamics, competitors’ strategies, product portfolio, market position, and financial performance.
* **Communication and stakeholder engagement:** Cultivate strong relationships stakeholders at all levels. Verbally convey recommendations, effectively manage expectations of key stakeholders, and provide regular project status updates.
* **Strategic collaboration and question facilitation:** Collaborate with various cross-functional partners, professionally challenge current and/or traditional ways of thinking and lead new ways/approaches. Facilitate questions that provoke critical thinking and drive deeper understanding of strategic challenges and opportunities.
* **Continuous Improvement:** Continuously refine and improve frameworks, methodologies, and processes based on feedback and evolving needs.
* **Financial Models:** Build basic financial models (or interest in learning) to understand impacts, quantify opportunities, and develop recommendations/case for change

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree required
* 4+ years of experience in a fast-paced environment including 1 year of relevant strategy or consulting experience. Experience with consumer products preferred, but not required.
* Project management experience, including i) sole ownership of distinct work streams ii) ability to coordinate work across various levels of the organization iii) problem-solve roadblocks
* Involvement of all phases of a project: initiation, plan, execution, and monitoring
* Skilled in interpreting other forms of advanced research and coalescing disparate information sources into an integrated “answer” for the issues at hand.
* Excellent critical thinking, analytical, and problem-solving skills
* Must be highly motivated, eager to learn, with the ability to devise an effective solution in unstructured situations.
* High proficiency in Excel and PowerPoint
* Personal qualities: Resilient, driven, proactive, curious, flexible, positive, collaborative


Newell Brands (NASDAQ: NWL) is a leading global consumer goods company with a strong portfolio of well-known brands, including Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Graco, Coleman, Rubbermaid Commercial Products, Yankee Candle, Paper Mate, FoodSaver, Dymo, EXPO, Elmer’s, Oster, NUK, Spontex and Campingaz. We are focused on delighting consumers by lighting up everyday moments. Newell Brands and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and comply with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

title: Receptionist
description:
**About Citco**

Citco is a global leader in fund services, corporate governance and related asset services with staff across 50 office locations worldwide. With more than $1.8 trillion in assets under administration, we deliver end-to-end solutions and exceptional service to meet our clients’ needs.


For more information about Citco, please visit www.citco.com


**About the Team & Business Line:**

Citco Group provides services to our Citco Group of Companies and helps business to succeed in client service excellence.


As a valuable member of our team, you will work closely with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to support business operations and help them to achieve their goals.


  
**Your Role:**

Reporting to the Marketing Events VP, the Receptionist will be part of the Group Marketing team and will handle office management duties on the 30th floor of the New York office and assist with event coordination. The responsibilities below are designed to give an overview of the role and requirements.


* You will provide a welcoming, professional reception and office environment. You will ensure the office operates smoothly and efficiently. You must enjoy helping others and must have excellent people skills alongside outstanding organizational and operational skills
* In-office attendance is required 5 days a week
* Welcome all guests upon arrival; greet and direct all visitors
* Ensure guests’ names are listed in lobby security for ease on arrival
* Ensure all visitors are made to feel comfortable and welcome – having a hospitable demeanor
* Handle all incoming calls courteously and professionally
* Maintain consistent awareness of all daily meetings and visitors
* Manage the professional appearance of conference rooms and events space
* Receive and sort all incoming and outgoing deliveries
* Process breakfast and luncheon orders, when necessary
* Assist the Events Manager with the delivery of in-house events held at the firm’s New York office (client seminars, conferences, receptions, parties, client/prospect meetings)
* Manage the calendar of events and scheduling of all meetings/events taking place on the 30th floor of the office
* Prepare supporting materials (literature packs, promotional merchandise, delegate lists, name badges, place names, table plans, etc.)
* Handle payment of invoices related to all events and activities that take place on the 30th floor.
* Coordinate the supply and order of promotional goods
* Maintain a strong relationship with building management and learn all aspects of the building portal.
* Conduct office manager duties such as, ordering office supplies, working with office vendors for repairs as needed and overall management and upkeep of the office space.
* In-office attendance is required 5 days a week .
* This role may require working late hours to ensure the success of an event.

  
**About You**

* You have strong time and project management skills
* Excellent communication skills
* Able to manage and implement tasks related to role with a low level of supervision
* Strong knowledge of MS Office applications and ability to learn new applications
* Strong attention to detail
* Aims to exceed expectations of high quality service delivery in every task
* Able to work collaboratively with others to provide a high quality service
* Bachelors degree (or equivalent) in hospitality, marketing or related area preferred

Salary - $53,000 - $74,000 USD
company_description: Citco Group is built on challenging paradigms and delivering exceptional service within the financial and professional services industry.

title: Medical Transcriptionist - Edgewater, NJ
description:
**$ 3,000 Sign-On Bonus for External Candidates**


**Optum** is a global organization that delivers care, aided by technology to help millions of people live healthier lives. The work you do with our team will directly improve health outcomes by connecting people with the care, pharmacy benefits, data, and resources they need to feel their best. Here, you will find a culture guided by diversity and inclusion, talented peers, comprehensive benefits, and career development opportunities. Come make an impact on the communities we serve as you help us advance health equity on a global scale. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**



This position is full time, Monday - Friday. Employees are required to have flexibility to work our normal business hours of 8:00am - 5:30pm EST. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime. Our office is located at 935 River Road Suite 301 Edgewater, NJ 07020.



We offer 2 - 3 weeks of on-the-job training. The hours of training will be aligned with your schedule.


**Primary Responsibilities:**



Jobs in this function provide medical transcription services directly to providers. This includes transcribing dictated information through the use of word processing to produce medical and clinical documents.


* Clerical position
* Document SOAP note
* Enters diagnoses, ICD 10’s
* Pends prescriptions, lab orders, referrals, and imaging studies for provider to sign
* Inputs billing, E&M code, and CPT codes for obesity, smoking, depression and alcohol/drug use.
* All computer responsibilities provider incurs, including ancillary software
* Prompts providers with questions appropriately regarding plan of care and orders
* Assists provider in any other nonmedical manners


General Job Profile


* Moderate work experience within own function.
* Some work is completed without established procedures.
* Basic tasks are completed without review by others.


Job Scope and Guidelines


* Applies knowledge/skills to activities that often vary from day to day.
* Demonstrates a moderate level of knowledge and skills in own function.
* Requires little assistance with standard and non-standard requests.
* Solves routine problems on own.
* Works with supervisor to solve more complex problems.
* Prioritizes and organizes own work to meet agreed upon deadlines.
* Works with others as part of a team.
  


You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* High School Diploma / GED
* Must be 18 years OR older
* Knowledge of medical terminology
* 1+ years experience as a medical transcriptionist
* Ability to work our normal business hours of 8:00am - 5:30pm EST, Monday - Friday. It may be necessary, given the business need, to work occasional overtime.


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* Bilingual fluency in English / Spanish

**Soft Skills:**


* Able to empathize with patients


**New Jersey Residents Only:** The hourly range for this is $16.54 - $32.55 per hour. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.



\\*\\*PLEASE NOTE\\*\\* The sign on bonus is only available to external candidates. Candidates who are currently working for a UnitedHealth Group, UnitedHealthcare or related entity in a full time, part time, or per diem basis ("Internal Candidates") are not eligible to receive a sign on bonus.


*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location, and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups, and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*


*UnitedHealth Group is a drug - free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.*


**#RPO #RED**

title: APC Manager - Clinical Services - New Jersey - Optum
description:
Optum Home & Community Care, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of businesses, is creating something new in health care. We are uniting industry-leading solutions to build an integrated care model that holistically addresses an individual’s physical, mental and social needs – helping patients access and navigate care anytime and anywhere.

  



As a team member of our Landmark product, we help bring home-based medical care to complex, chronic patients. This life-changing work helps give older adults more days at home**.**

  


We’re connecting care to create a seamless health journey for patients across care settings. Join us to start **Caring. Connecting. Growing together.**

  



The Landmark Health Clinical Team Manager (CTM) will directly manage the daily operations of the field staff Nurse Practitioners. Under the direction of the Regional Manager, the CTM will assist in planning strategies that result in efficiently managing specific markets while ensuring high quality services to our members. The CTM will be responsible for monitoring key performance metrics and quality improvement as well as procure internal and external relationships which will support expansion and success of HouseCalls business initiatives.

  



In this role you will have the ability to achieve work life balance. Flexible scheduling offered where providers can flex their time over the 7-day work week.



**Primary Responsibilities:**


* Program Management and Responsibilities:
+ Serve as a mentor and coach to Landmark Practitioners (HCP’s). The CTM will demonstrate clinical expertise and guidance, program insight, and support in all aspects of the role
+ Plan and conduct Ride Along visits in accordance with guidelines set forth by senior leadership
+ Travel is expected and is dependent upon specific market and geographical nee
+ Assist in hiring and training new HCP’s
+ Ensure enterprise, department, HIPPA, and regulatory compliance: Maintaining security of Protected Health Information (PHI) and Intellectual Property (IP)
+ Responsible for all GSS functions: Update status change, terminations, PTO management, population, and network development reconciliation
+ Perform yearly common reviews and continually manage performance
+ Implement coaching plans and/or corrective action plans related to standards set forth by business initiatives
+ Regular meetings and collaboration with supporting departments to ensure operational efficiency
+ Providing solutions to scheduling, assignments, and staffing plans
+ Plan and develop compelling market strategies and present to Senior Leadership during Business Reviews
+ Workforce management: Manages demands of a rapidly changing staffing environment with resilience
+ Analyzes and makes fact-based decisions utilizing forecasting model

* Staff Development and Engagement:
+ Host monthly team meetings to communicate updates on company goals and performance: Monitor and address field concerns and communicate to senior leadership
+ Represents HouseCalls in a positive, solution focused manner that embodies our corporate values: Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation and Performance
+ Develop strategies to increase job satisfaction and reduce turnover rates
+ Identify key talent and provide opportunities for professional growth and career advancement

  




You’ll be rewarded and recognized for your performance in an environment that will challenge you and give you clear direction on what it takes to succeed in your role as well as provide development for other roles you may be interested in.

**Required Qualifications:**


* Certified Nurse Practitioner or Physician Assistant through a national board
* Graduate of an accredited Master’s degree in Nursing (MSN) program or Doctor of Nursing practice (DNP) program and board certified through the American Academy of Nurse Practitioners (AANP) or the American Nurses Credentialing Center (ANCC), Adult-Gerontology Acute Care Nurse Practitioners (AG AC NP), Adult/Family or Gerontology Nurse Practitioners (ACNP), with preferred certification as ANP, FNP, or GNP
* Active and unrestricted license in the State of New Jersey
* Current active DEA licensure/prescriptive authority or ability to obtain post-hire, per state regulations (unless prohibited in state of practice)
* 3+ years of experience as an APC, demonstrating progressive responsibility
* Access to reliable transportation that will enable you to travel to client and/or patient sites within a designated area
* Ability to lift a 30-pound bag in and out of car and to navigate stairs and a variety of dwelling conditions and configurations
* Ability to gain a collaborative practice agreement, if applicable in your state

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**


* 3+ years of previous management experience
* 2+ years of leadership and management experience in an organization that serves the chronically ill
* 2+ years of Medicare experience
* 1+ years of hands-on post grad experience
* 1+ years of experience as a CSM at Optum
* Leadership and management experience in a CCM market as a CSM with success in effective team building and quality improvement
* Ability to quickly adapt to change and drive change management within team and market
* Possesses a high level of organizational skills, self- motivation, and ability to manage time independently
* Proficient computer skills including the ability to document medical information with written and electronic medical records
* Proficient in MS Excel
* Possess knowledge and understanding of geriatrics clinical management
* Ability to develop and maintain positive customer relationships
* Ability to work across functions and businesses to achieve business goals
* Effective in motivating and mentoring colleagues and peers


**New Jersey Residents Only**: The salary range for this role is $104,700 to $190,400 annually. Pay is based on several factors including but not limited to local labor markets, education, work experience, certifications, etc. UnitedHealth Group complies with all minimum wage laws as applicable. In addition to your salary, UnitedHealth Group offers benefits such as, a comprehensive benefits package, incentive and recognition programs, equity stock purchase and 401k contribution (all benefits are subject to eligibility requirements). No matter where or when you begin a career with UnitedHealth Group, you’ll find a far-reaching choice of benefits and incentives.

  


*At UnitedHealth Group, our mission is to help people live healthier lives and make the health system work better for everyone. We believe everyone–of every race, gender, sexuality, age, location and income–deserves the opportunity to live their healthiest life. Today, however, there are still far too many barriers to good health which are disproportionately experienced by people of color, historically marginalized groups and those with lower incomes. We are committed to mitigating our impact on the environment and enabling and delivering equitable care that addresses health disparities and improves health outcomes — an enterprise priority reflected in our mission.*

  


*Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Procurement Director, Divisional Leader
description:
**Job Title: Director Procurement, Divisional Lead**

**Location: Somerset, NJ**

**Position Summary:**


Responsible for leadership of procurement sites, sourcing and procuring materials, services and capital for multiple sites. Lead site procurement teams and initiate and foster relationships with site stakeholders, establishing and prioritizing activities for their site teams to achieve objectives and results. Work closely with other regional directors, the GPO, key support departments, and critical stakeholders across the company.

**The Role:**

* Ensure site procurement is engaged and aligned with internal customers/stakeholders, gaining stakeholder and leadership support across the sites.
* Utilize sourcing and category management processes across sites to understand the business requirements, build the portfolio of purchasing projects and develop sourcing strategies aligned to stakeholder needs.
* Identify opportunities, synergies, and risk mitigation across sites to drive procurement value creation.
* Develop pipeline of opportunities (savings, cash flow, growth, other value), representing local, regional, and global initiatives.
* Ensure annual procurement budget (savings, cost avoidance, inflation) are met.
* Integrate with GPO, including Category Management, Supplier Relationship Management, Capital, CSR/D&I, and PMO to ensure regions are aligned with GPO initiatives.
* Actively participate in building and/or delivering Op Mech, QBR, and other site procurement updates and messaging to stakeholders.
* Design, socialize and implement a regional procurement organization, in alignment with the GPO Roadmap and Divisional strategic needs.
* Execute succession planning and talent development for key positions.
* Ensure sites are utilizing tools for net cost monitoring, reporting, and communicating procurement progress.
* Minimize impact of supplier shortages by proactively identifying and resolving potential material supply issues, timely communication, collaborating with Supply Chain for inventory build, and proper escalation.
* Demonstrate expertise in the engagement and utilization of sourcing and procurement tools including RFx’s, contracting and scorecards/reports/communications, etc.
* Ensure that site procurement teams drive compliance to Procurement Policies and Procedures.
* Prepare regional annual sourcing plans linked to annual profit plans in order to maximize value contribution, drive improvements and minimize risks.
* Conduct business in an ethical and professional manner to ensure avoidance of all actual and potential conflicts of interest.

**The Candidate:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Finance, Operations, Supply Chain or comparable disciplines. Masters preferred; Industry certifications a plus
* Minimum of 10 years of progressive international experience in a procurement leadership capacity
* Working knowledge and experience of procurement and best-in-class practices, principles, process, tools and methodologies
* Can demonstrate the successful development and implementation of sourcing strategies
* Clear knowledge and understanding of supply market, industry and category dynamics
* A successful track record leading and managing complex negotiations
* Demonstrates strong business judgment and critical thinking to create and evaluate innovative options and uses a fact based decision making process to develop and implement strategies that will drive positive results and deliver value
* Possesses a strong working knowledge and experience in key procurement areas including:
* Capex
* Commodity trading
* Insourcing/Outsourcing analysis and assessment
* Cost Modeling/TCO
* Legal and Contract law
* New product development and sourcing
* Effectively assesses risk and implements mitigation plans to either prevent or minimize impact to ensure business continuity
* Capable of technical and commercial assessments and appraisals of potential and existing sources of supplies
* Expertise in supporting Supplier Management and Category Management programs
* Strong analytical skills including financial management and metrics
* Understands the key business drivers and requirements to build and sustain sourcing strategies and best in class procurement processes and practices
* Has a proven track record of engaging and working with stakeholders to understand business requirements and gain support for the development, approval and implementation of procurement and sourcing strategies
* Demonstrates strong analytical skills including and understanding and application of financial analysis tools
* Keeps abreast of key market information, trends, and innovations needed to continue to drive excellence
* Direct knowledge of Enterprise Resources Planning software and procurement systems and their functionality
* Demonstrated leadership expertise and the ability to interact with all levels of management and Associates.
* Ability to build and lead functional/cross-functional teams across a region of sites.
* Understands and has experience in successfully managing change initiatives
* Experience and success as a facilitator
* Encourages collaboration at all levels across functional boundaries, between procurement and the business
* Collaborative, strong relationship builder, with a proven track record of establishing and maintaining effective internal and external customer/supplier relationships
* Actively engages colleagues to make joint decisions and share best practices.
* Strong interpersonal and effective oral and written communication skills
* Ability to effectively deal with conflict and defuse and resolve difficult situations
* Ability to influence and persuade others
* Sensitivity and understanding of Cultural differences and the ability to effectively engage on a global basis
* Demonstrates passion and commitment to achieving and delivering results against established goals and objectives
* Demonstrates a willingness to constructively challenge the status quo
* Use of facts, data and insights to help support an effective and timely decision making process.
* Understands problems and solves them through the application of experiential, conceptual and innovative thinking

**Why you should join Catalent**

* Comprehensive Benefit Package (Health, Dental, Vision, & Life Insurance)
* Paid Time Off Programs incl. vacation, banked time & personal time.
* Employee Reward & Recognition programs.
* Opportunities for professional and personal development & growth including tuition reimbursement

**Catalent offers rewarding opportunities to further your career!** Join the global drug development and delivery leader and help us bring over 7,000 life-saving and life-enhancing products to patients around the world. Catalent is an exciting and growing international company where employees work directly with pharma, biopharma and consumer health companies of all sizes to advance new medicines from early development to clinical trials and to the market. Catalent produces more than 70 billion doses per year, and each one will be used by someone who is counting on us. Join us in making a difference.


Catalent is committed to the health and safety of its employees, visitors and the customers and patients we serve. As a result of the global pandemic, we have modified many of our recruitment and on-boarding processes to maintain everyone’s safety. The Human Resources teams will communicate all necessary safety processes and procedures throughout each stage.

  

personal initiative. dynamic pace. meaningful work.


Visit Catalent Careers to explore career opportunities.


Catalent is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and veterans.


If you require reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process due to a disability, you may submit your request by sending an email, and confirming your request for an accommodation and include the job number, title and location to DisabilityAccommodations@catalent.com. This option is reserved for individuals who require accommodation due to a disability. Information received will be processed by a U.S. Catalent employee and then routed to a local recruiter who will provide assistance to ensure appropriate consideration in the application or hiring process.

  

Notice to Agency and Search Firm Representatives: Catalent Pharma Solutions (Catalent) is not accepting unsolicited resumes from agencies and/or search firms for this job posting. Resumes submitted to any Catalent employee by a third party agency and/or search firm without a valid written & signed search agreement, will become the sole property of Catalent. No fee will be paid if a candidate is hired for this position as a result of an unsolicited agency or search firm referral. Thank you.


Important Security Notice to U.S. Job Seekers:


Catalent NEVER asks candidates to provide any type of payment, bank details, photocopies of identification, social security number or other highly sensitive personal information during the offer process, and we NEVER do so via email or social media. If you receive any such request, DO NOT respond— it is a fraudulent request. Please forward such requests to spam@catalent.com for us to investigate with local authorities.


California Job Seekers can find our California Job Applicant Notice HERE.

title: Trainer II
company: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey
description:
Horizon BCBSNJ employees must live in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Connecticut or Delaware
Job Summary:
Responsible for training delivery and contributing to the development of learning solutions at enterprise sites and at remote vendor locations.
1. Collaborate with other Service Training & Development areas for input into learning solution program design and implementation through the most appropriate training method.  

2. Responsible for training delivery on new hire training material and content at Horizon sites, remote vendor locations.  

3. Assists with the development and customizing of training materials including, but not limited to; content, lesson plans; exercises and assessments in the partnership with the Sr Trainer and ISD team.  

4. Partner with Coaching, Quality and Operations during and after training period to ensure optimal learning experience, smooth post-training transition, on-going monitoring.  

5. Assist Supervisor with the modification of training resources/schedules in response to staffing issues and/or business needs.  

6. Escalate system and operations issues reported to training or identified through analysis and assist with problem resolution.  

7. The information above is intended to describe the general nature of the work being performed by each incumbent assigned to this position. This job description is not designed to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of each incumbent.
Education/Experience:  

Bachelors Degree preferred  

Candidates with a Bachelors degree require 1 years of experience in a call center environment or in a role commensurate to a Trainer.  

In Lieu of a degree an additional 3 years of experience, as described above, can be substituted  

  

Additional licensing, certifications, registrations:  

Certificate programs from TD (ASTD) a plus  

Knowledge:  

Knowledge of adult learning theory  

Knowledge of training programs  

Knowledge of facilitating learning  

Knowledge of insurance/ healthcare industry  

Skills and Abilities:  

Current industry trends, learning solution Best Practices, technology based training administration systems helpful, healthcare industry knowledge, claims processing experience helpful  

Dynamic facilitation skills

title: Cashier ($400 Hiring Incentive!)
description:
Family owned and operated for over **50 years**, Mamoun’s Falafel is the oldest falafel restaurant in NYC and one of the first Middle Eastern brands in the country.

  

Our culture is driven by the legacy established by our founder, Mamoun, whose commitment to excellence and passion for hospitality transformed a small, hole-in-the-wall eatery into a premier falafel brand and a NYC landmark. Our mission is to serve fresh, authentic Middle Eastern food as quickly and as friendly as possible while creating an atmosphere that is energetic, upbeat, welcoming, and responsive for both guests and staff.

  

We are looking for **cashiers** to join our team. Our **cashiers** are the ambassadors of our restaurants and handle all major aspects of our customer service, including taking orders and communicating with our guests, packaging and handing off orders, and keeping the restaurant clean while assisting fellow team members.

  

**Why work at Mamoun’s?**

* **Great Pay** – our pay rates start at $15.50 per hour **PLUS** an extra $1-$3 per hour in tips!

* **$400 Signing Bonus** – receive **$200 after your first 30 days** (based on at least 100 total hours worked) and an additional **$200 after 60 days** (based on at least 200 total hours worked). *(Only available for first time hires.)*

* **Work Anniversary Bonus!** Paid each year on your anniversary - you will receive an extra week’s pay calculated by multiplying your average weekly hours for the year by your current pay rate.

* **Referral Bonus** – receive $200 when you refer someone through our referral program.

* **Paid Breaks with Free Shift Meals**

* **No prior experience necessary** - our training program will teach you everything you need to know and set you up for success.

* **Growth opportunities** – enter our development program and become the next Team Member promoted to **Team Leader**, **Assistant Manager**, or **General Manager**! And if you love training people, become an **in-store trainer** with the opportunity to support a **New Store Opening** (get to travel)!

* **Develop life skills** - we focus on developing our team members so that their success at Mamoun’s will translate into success in other areas of life, including other career or work opportunities.

  

**Job Requirements**

  

* Available to work daytime shifts (10 am - 4 pm)
* Positive and friendly attitude
* Ability to speak, see, hear, read, and write
* Ability to multi-task (perform multiple functions at the same time)
* Ability to bend, stoop, stand, and walk for extended periods of time
* Ability to lift and carry at least 30 lbs and perform other diverse physical tasks as needed
* Develop thorough knowledge of our menu (taught during training)
* Execute standard operating procedures for all FOH positions (taught during training)
* Execute opening and closing checklists (taught during training)

  

Learn more about Mamoun’s by visiting our website at www.mamouns.com.  



  

Mamoun’s Falafel is an **Equal Opportunity** employer.
INDFOH

title: Medical Director-2
company: Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield of New Jersey
description:
Horizon BCBSNJ employees must live in New Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Connecticut or Delaware
Job Summary:
The Medical Director is a medical spokesperson for Horizon Blue Cross Blue Shield with the provider network across NJ. The Medical Director will be accountable for providing leadership, direction and daily support for their assigned region of NJ and assigned providers; the scope of activities include, but are not limited to, utilization management, care management, disease management, quality management, pharmacy management, post service reviews, provider education, support for provider relations issues, and clinical transformation. The Medical Director is accountable for a personal caseload of daily medical management activities and contributing to operational effectiveness of the medical management program.  

  

Medical Policy and HPIRIT only:  

The position has primary responsibility for the medical review for the Clinical Inquiries Team (CIT) and support special investigations unit as needed. Also, the position supports the development and implementation of reimbursement policies.
Responsibilities:* Support all lines of business which includes Commercial and Government Programs.
* Collaborate with value based teams, Behavioral Health and Pharmacy; supports accounts and activities for cross functional areas by region, where applicable. Supports sales teams as assigned by region.
* Guides, supports and consults with nurse reviewers on pre-authorization, concurrent and retrospective review issues, post-service reviews, pre-determinations and decisions, where applicable. Consult with/support case management to determine best course for members, assist with PG and address issues.
* Develops and maintains effective collaborative relationships with providers in assigned geographic areas. This includes on site or virtual review of performance and coaching activities with physicians, hospitals and ancillary providers.
* May provide input into provider credentialing, profiling and communication initiatives.
* Responsible for data analysis on case management and utilization, identify issues and escalate as necessary to senior management.
* Interprets and analyzes available utilization, cost and quality reports and develops steps to address variances to target performance matrix. Collaborates on documentation of monthly reporting address performance, issues and activities for assigned region.
* Assists with assessment of network capabilities by region and collaborates with network management, contracting and value based teams in addressing network gaps.
* Creates/participates in internal or external educational activities for other members of the team/stakeholders across regional/functional areas.
* Participates in Committee activities as assigned.
* Assist with coverage across functional MD teams, as needed, including participation in calls for all areas.
* Support medical policy development process, review medical and pharmacy policies and provide feedback regarding utilization to the development team.
* Works with legal and mandate team to support Horizon’s compliance with the NJ Department of banking and insurance (DOBI).
* Backup chair for committees with internal and external stakeholders


Medical Policy and HPIRIT only:* Performs medical reviews for the Clinical Inquiries Team (CIT) and support special investigations unit as needed
* Support development and implementation of reimbursement policies
* Assist with coverage across functional MD teams as needed including participation in calls for all areas


Functional Competencies:* Knowledge in the principles of Utilization Management, Case Management, Quality Management and accreditation/regulatory standards.-
* Requires broad clinical knowledge and understanding of current health care issues and climate.
* Requires some knowledge of health insurance payer business including business operations.


Qualifications:* Requires Board Certification in an American Board of Medicine recognized specialty Requires current unrestricted MD or DO license to practice medicine.
* Requires 5-7 years clinical experience with managing data to identify key issues, developing recommendations and providing content/conclusions to executive management.
* Proficiency working with Tableau or similar software required.
* Proficiency also required working with a Windows based environment including MS Office products.
* Continuous Improvement experience preferred.


Specific to Medical Policy:* Ability to review studies, understand evidence based medicine and support medical policy development.
* Ability to chair committees with internal and external stakeholders


Additional licensing, certifications, registrations:* Active Unrestricted MD or DO license required; NJ license required; No CMS Sanctions or sanctions by other regulatory agencies or boards.
* Must be board certified by a specialty recognized by the American Osteopathic Association or the American Board of Medical Specialties


Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:* Business Acumen: Identify key issues and opportunities, developing strategies and plans and have resolute decision making.
* Planning and Organizing: Leveraging resources, staying focused and effectively prioritizing key objectives.
* Building Strategic Working Relationships: Proactively tries to build effective working relationships; facilitates agreement; clarifies current situation; involving appropriate individuals within team and broader organization to achieve desired results
* Executive Presence: Advocates for the organization, inspiring confidence among peers regarding reliability and capability, inspiring senior leadership expectations on potential for outstanding outcomes and achievements.
* Meeting Leadership: Ensures a meeting serves its business objectives; facilitating agreement; develops others' and own ideas; closes discussions with clear summaries
* Negotiation: Effectively exploring alternatives and positions to reach outcomes that gain the support and acceptance of all parties.
* Matrix Environment: Ability to function and work in a matrix environment which includes working on and at time leading cross functional teams.
* Conflict resolution: ability to identify conflict, determine its causes and negotiate mutually agreeable solutions


Travel % (If Applicable):* The position requires access to a car and the ability to travel for meetings with physicians, hospitals and ancillary providers as required.


Salary Range:
$207,800 - $289,170
This compensation range is specific to the job level and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to: education, experience, licensure, certifications, geographic location, and internal equity. This range has been created in good faith based on information known to Horizon at the time of posting. Compensation decisions are dependent on the circumstances of each case. Horizon also provides a comprehensive compensation and benefits package which includes:* Comprehensive health benefits (Medical/Dental/Vision)
* Retirement Plans

title: Sales Floor Manager
description:
Overview:  
We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Floor Manager to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the sales floor and driving sales growth through effective sales management and customer service. This role is critical to the success of our store and requires a leader who can inspire and motivate their team to achieve their goals.

Responsibilities:

- Manage the sales floor to ensure a positive and welcoming shopping environment for customers  
- Oversee the Budtender team to ensure they are providing excellent customer service  
- Conduct sales training and coaching sessions to improve sales skills and product knowledge  
- Assist with inventory control and stock management, including replenishing  
- Process sales and handle cash and credit transactions accurately and efficiently  
- Ensure that all cash handling procedures are followed and maintain a clean and organized sales floor  
- Manage and maintain a clean and organized sales floor, including maintaining display areas  
- Conduct sales floor visual merchandising and maintain a visually appealing store  
- Develop and maintain relationships with customers to build customer loyalty and increase sales  
- Assist with recruiting and hiring new sales team members  
- Conduct performance reviews and provide feedback to management

Requirements:

- Proven experience in sales management or a related field  
- Strong knowledge of retail sales, including sales techniques and customer service  
- Ability to communicate effectively with customers and team members  
- Experience with cash handling and operating a cash register  
- Experience with inventory control and stock management  
- Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines  
- Strong leadership skills and the ability to motivate and inspire a team  
- Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail  
- Ability to work a flexible schedule, including evenings and weekends  
- Bilingual or multilingual skills are an asset  
- Experience with wireless sales is an asset  
- High school diploma or equivalent is required

Skills:

- Stock management  
- Sales management  
- Bilingual  
- Retail sales  
- Cash register  
- Cash handling  
- Clerk  
- Interviewing  
- Inventory control  
- Wireless sales

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $23.00 - $26.00 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule

Shift:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Morning shift
* Night shift

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Application Question(s):

* A customer approaches the counter at an eyewear store and silently looks at the displays. Some other customers walk in behind him.

What would you do?  
A. Ask the first customer some questions to find out what he's looking for  
B. Remain silent, allowing all customers to look at the merchandise  
C. Politely ask the first customer to move aside so you can help customers who are ready  
D. Make some general suggestions about sunglasses that are on sale  
E. Ask the other customers if they have any questions

* Which inventory control strategy would help your store meet customer demand while minimizing excess storage costs?

A. Following a just-in-time system of ordering items only as they're needed  
B. Ordering the same quantity of items every month regardless of seasonality  
C. Maintaining a high level of inventory for all products to prevent stockouts whenever demand increases  
D. Following a first-in, first-out system for non-perishable items to manage inventory levels  
E. Buying inventory in bulk once a year to benefit from quantity discounts

* A client is upset about a service delay. He's speaking loudly and attracting attention.

What would you do?  
A. Acknowledge his feelings and explain how you'll try to speed things up  
B. Politely ask him to calm down and explain that getting upset won't help speed things up  
C. Explain that all clients are equally important and you're doing your best  
D. Suggest he contact the customer service hotline  
E. Direct him to speak to your supervisor

Experience:

* Customer service: 2 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* New York, NY 10002 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10002: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Lawn Care Operations Manager
description:
A day in the life for this position could vary each day! However, you will lead, train, and grow your team to help make our clients’ dream lawns come to life each day. Specifically, The Operations Manager position assists the Owner and senior leadership of Weed Man Lawn Care with the overall day to day operations of the company. The position is responsible for overall efficiency and profitability of services and crews. The position is also responsible for scheduling, inventory, hiring, managing, ordering, and quality control. In addition, this person will also drive production monitor efficiencies of the crews/jobs and the training of staff as well.

Our ideal candidate is one that loves to lead their team and loves delivering customer service through executing our processes via our teams. This person is also a team player and a team builder who enjoys skill sharing, is a problem solver, and is looking for a long-term position with us.

**Key Responsibilities & Duties**

* Assists in resolving customer concerns in all operational and quality control areas
* Manages the execution of lawn care projects & maintenance activities
* Manages Safety Records and Safety compliance of crews and other staff
* Ensures staff correctly reports service times
* Manages the crews to ensure they understand notes and have the proper tools
* Ensures all crews have the materials they need
* Plans routes and updates the scheduling of field staff and client’s work
* Makes sure all inventory is available and accounted for office use or field use
* Orders inventory and supplies for shop use and field use
* Manages the quality control process in its entirety
* Creates systems and processes to increase efficiency
* Responsible for the maintenance of all trucks, trailers, and equipment
* Assists with hiring of field staff employees
* Assists with time off requests, staffing levels, and write-ups, all the while making sure they are approved
* Drives the training of new hires and is responsible for ongoing training of field staff
* Performs Quality Control checks on properties and uses them for training purposes
* Tracks budget vs. actual job times and manages improvement and efficiency of times
* Manages and improves all service times and develop strategy for reducing labor costs and increasing revenue per crew per day

**Required Education and Licenses**

* Valid driver’s license and ability to be insured on company policy

**Required Work Experience and Skills**

* 3 years of hands-on management experience in a related field
* Collaboration experience but comfortable working alone or without supervision
* Ability to work with hand tools, power tools, small engine equipment, heavy equipment, and materials as needed
* Knowledge of Quality control and inventory control
* Experience in Hiring, Training, and Scheduling
* Demonstrated Problem Solving/Analysis skills
* Excellent Customer Service and Client Focus
* Strong logistical skills
* Ability to maintain composure and keep a positive attitude
* Ability to lift a minimum of 50 lbs.
* Ability to work flexible working hours, including Saturday work if necessary, and longer work weeks during the busy season

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $60,413.00 - $63,870.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Wall, NJ (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Wall, NJ: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person
